string.text: You scared me, Beast… You were out like a light for so long. We’re in deep shit right now…
The hell… What happened?

I’m not sure, but it’s nothing good… That creature’s gotta be messing with us. We shouldn’t have gone there. The second I sent you that message, I got knocked out, and then I woke up here. I think this might be its den. I got excited at first because I thought I was finally out of that damn anomaly, but according to my PDA, we’re still in it. Just underground.
That’s sad news. But what kind of creature are you talking about?

I saw it a couple of times, but I didn’t say a word about it to anyone. They’d think I’m insane. But I’m not… Physically, it kind of looks like a bloodsucker, but it acts and talks like a normal human being, and it even wears clothes… I also saw an entry in my contacts named “Stronglav.” But it can’t be a human. And that’s not even the worst part: I tried to kill it, but as soon as I opened fire, it just laughed at me again and straight up vanished! It laughed at me, Beast! I just don’t know what to do…
I saw it too; thought I was just seeing things. We need to find a way out of here, Markus, and we will find it.
You think I haven’t tried finding a way out?! There’s a ladder further into the cave, but if you try to climb it, there’s something that holds you back… Wait… You feel that?!
What am I supposed I feel?
That smell… It’s like something’s burning. It’s the same smell from when I first saw the creature. Don’t move! I think the resident of this lair is coming back.
Fantastic…
You gave away our position. And you managed to grab the attention of those things…
I don’t know. I was just trying to kill it, but… What is even going on?
How should I know? We have to get out of here fast. It’s gonna return soon…
Agreed. We’re done for if we just sit here. Let’s go look for a way out.
I’m not in any condition to go exploring. It’s better if you go look for an exit while I cover you in case it comes back.
Sounds good to me.
All right. Keep an eye out for the exit. Message me if you find anything. Don’t worry about me; I’ll make it out on my own. Now hurry!
Okay. I’m going.
Beast, what was that? What is even going on?! It’s gone, but I fear it’ll be back soon…
I can’t give you an answer to that. I have no idea what’s going on.
It laughed again. It might’ve seen us. We need to get out of here fast.
Yeah. We can’t waste any time finding a way out of here.
I’m not in any condition to go exploring. It’s better if you go look for an exit while I cover you in case it comes back.
Sounds good to me.
All right. Keep an eye out for the exit. Message me if you find anything. Don’t worry about me; I’ll make it out on my own. Now hurry!
Okay. I’m going.
Hey, Knucklehead, how are you feeling?
Could be better… but I’ll hold up for now. Any news?
Unfortunately, I have two doses of medicine left but three patients to treat. I decided to give one dose to you.
Beast, no. Don’t give it to me. The others have their whole lives ahead of them… I’ve already lived mine.
I’ll find more medicine. We still have time.
Thank you, Beast. Thank you for everything. But… we may as well say our goodbyes here. This may be the last time we speak.
No. It’s too early to say goodbye. I will find a cure.
I’ve found some more medicine, but it’s not much.
Sorry, Knucklehead, but I’ve already given it to someone else.
Let’s talk later.
Beast, don’t worry too much about it. Each to his own fate. If I’m to die here, then so be it. You can’t blame yourself for it.
I’ll find more medicine. We still have time.
Thank you, Beast. Thank you for everything. But… we may as well say our goodbyes here. This may be the last time we speak.
No. It’s too early to say goodbye. I will find a cure.
That’s good to hear. But is it enough for everyone?
How are you feeling, Markus?
I wish I could say I’m feeling good, but that would be a load of bull. I’ve never felt this shitty in my life. I feel like I could die any minute… Did you find any medicine?
Yes. I’ve found a dose for you. It’ll help alleviate the symptoms.
Let’s talk later.
Well, at least I have a fighting chance now. Give me the medicine.
Here.
Thank you for trying to save my life, Beast. It means a lot to me.
It’s all I can do.
How are you feeling, Cutter?
Eh. I’ve been better… What’s up, though?
I’ve got some medicine.
Never mind.
Oh, that’s music to my ears. How much did you find?…
Only two doses. I’m giving one of them to you. That’s all I have, unfortunately.
So that means, after I take the dose, I either die or join the ranks of the healthy once more. Still, thank you, Beast.
Get well, Cutter.

Well, there’s not a lot from choose from around here, so we’ll have to change up your usual diet. Go shoot down a few boars, then cook their meat at a campfire. I know it’s not exactly gourmet stuff, but at least you won’t be wandering on an empty stomach.
Need something, merc?
All right. I guess that’s how it is… Is there anything else you wanted to tell me?
We’re out of supplies. Savage said you’d be able to help.

This might be news to you, but we’re out of edible food. You had some canned food and sausages on you when you came here, but we’ve already eaten through all of it… And now we’ve had to resort to eating the local wildlife again; namely, boars and pseudodogs. Of course, there’s a chance of food poisoning, but if you cook it up right, it won’t be a problem.
Never imagined myself eating the wildlife of the Zone, but we don’t have much of a choice…
So how do I prepare the meat properly?
I’ll tell you what: go cook a piece of meat. I’ll check it out myself and tell you if you did anything wrong. Also, keep some of the boar fat; it’s one of the tastiest parts from the animal.
Okay, Knucklehead. You got it.
Wait. I know you… You’re that mercenary, right? The one that helped me hunt down that psy-dog in the Cordon?
Got some cooked boar meat yet, Beast?
Yep. Here.
Not yet.
Well… You did good on cooking this. Perfectly edible. There’s pretty much no chance of getting poisoned from this.
Thanks for the comment. I’ll keep it in mind. Getting this meat should be a lot easier than other types of food.
Don’t mention it, merc. I hope you’ll remember how to cook meat properly. It’ll be useful.
I’ll remember; don’t worry. I’ve got to go now.
Need something, merc?
Yup. Small world, huh?
Need something, merc?
Sure is. You guys sure caused some mayhem back there… My lips are sealed, though, so don’t worry about it.
I was only doing my job. Nothing more.
If you say so… Well, anyway, I won’t take up any more of your time. See you!
Yeah. See you.
Need something, merc?
I’m ready to hunt the chimera.
Excellent. We can move out right now. The chimera should be in the bunker.
Hold on just a second. I told you the chimera only goes inside the bunker at nighttime. It’s too early right now. Come back around two in the morning.
Let’s go, then.
I’ll return to you later, then.
Okay. That’s all I needed to know.
The chimera only enters the bunker at nighttime, so we may as well go right now.
Then come see me around two AM. That’s when the chimera tends to be there.
Hey, Beast. What’s up?
Let’s go now, then.
All right. I’ll talk to you again at night.
There. We can finally stop worrying about that thing sneaking into our base. Thanks for the help.
Don’t mention it. Another dead mutant is good for all of us. You can bet I’ll be sleeping easier tonight, too.

Yeah. By the way, I bet you’ve noticed that our food sources are running out fast. However, I’ve been trying out a new food source for about a week; haven’t told the others about it yet. They’ll probably be disgusted at the thought of trying it…
Hey, Beast. Heard you found Scavenger… Sucks that he turned out to be such a piece of shit, but at least that’s over with. Anyway, I needed to talk to you about something important.
Well? Get to the point. What’s this food source of yours?

Well, while the others have been eating their canned goods, I’ve been eating the local wildlife. Naturally, there’s a chance of getting poisoned at any moment, but if you cook the meat the right way, it shouldn’t be a problem.
Nothing wrong with that. A mutated boar’s not exactly as tasty as a stuffed rabbit, but it’s edible. Wouldn’t be the first time I try it.

I had a feeling you’d get me, Beast. But there’s more than just the boars: I’ve been trying the dog meat lately. Very different taste; it’s also nowhere as hard as boar meat. Listen, how about we try to change your diet? Go shoot down a few boars, then cook their meat at a campfire. I know it’s not exactly gourmet stuff, but at least you won’t be wandering on an empty stomach.
Yeah, sure. I was getting hungry anyway.
Listen, you mind bringing me a piece as well? All this hunting’s got me feeling pretty hungry. Also, keep some of the boar fat; it’s one of the tastiest parts from the animal.
Sure thing, Knucklehead. I’m going.
So, Beast, you bring some of those cuts of meat yet?
Yeah. Here you go.
Let’s have it. I’m all ears.
Not yet.
Great. Oh, you cooked it right. Just what we need right now. Thanks!
Thanks for the advice. Around here, meat is one of the easier food sources to get a hold of.
By the way, Markus told me to tell you to see him. When you have a free moment, of course.
All right. I’ll go talk to him. See you.
Hey, Beast. Need anything?
By the way, Markus told me to tell you to see him. When you have a free moment, of course.
All right. I’ll go talk to him. See you.

We’ve got a serious problem on our hands. A couple of days ago, I saw a chimera near our base. I was by myself and had almost no ammo on me, so I didn’t shoot. Good thing it didn’t see me. It’s a dangerous creature, and tracking it down will be difficult. And just imagine what’ll happen if it wanders into our camp at night.
So what do you suggest?

We need to kill it. We’re more likely to do any damage during nighttime, when the mutant goes to sleep in the northern bunker. The two of us can handle it without a problem; it won’t know what hit it. What do you think of my plan? Any questions?
Just the two of us? Wouldn’t it be safer with more people?
We’re the only ones with enough ammo for the job. The others are short of any rounds. Don’t worry; I’ve dealt with with these creatures before. We’ll do fine.
About your gun…
So? Do you have it or not?
Yeah. I have it. Also, I ran into the bloodsucker that scared you earlier; it was waiting there.
Not yet.
It didn’t scare me… It’s just that things screwed up. Had no choice but to run.
Spare me the excuses. I don’t care whether it scared you or not. Here’s your gun.

Thanks. Now I can go on raids with the guys and not stay behind. Plus, it’s a lot safer here when you have a gun. Here’s a small reward for your good work. I don’t need the money anymore, but maybe you’ll need it.
Thanks. I’ll be on my way.
So, soldier, tell me: where’d you drop your gun? Can you at least estimate its location?
I can show you the exact place, actually. I know where the gun is.
So, what’s the problem, then? You can go get the gun yourselves. You’d already be done by now, and you wouldn’t be taking up my time.

See, here’s the thing… I didn’t lose the gun. I threw it away.
 
When I was scouting, I was attacked by a bloodsucker. I fired at it, but then, my gun jammed. I had no time to reload it, so I threw it at the bloodsucker, then shot it with my pistol a couple of times and bolted. I can’t tell the general I ran away from a mutant, and taking one of those things on with a pistol is suicide.
 
Help me out here, stalker, and return the rifle to me; I’ll owe you greatly.
Well, what can you do? All right. I’ll look for your rifle.
Stop right there! Who are you? What are you doing here?
Take it easy, lieutenant. I’m a mercenary—callsign Beast—sent here to restart a transformer.
Hmm. Let’s say I believe you… How’d you open the cage door?
Someone helped me open it. What about you, though? How long have you been stuck here?
You think I’m gonna tell you everything just like that? Go talk to the general. Maybe he’ll talk to you…
Okay. I’ll speak to your general, then.
Hey, merc… Give me… some water. I won’t last much longer without some water…
What the hell? I can’t. I can’t walk up to you; something’s teleporting me back. What’s happening here?

Most likely an anomaly… Just really small. I can’t get out of here, and I’ve run out of food and water. And the guys… One of them disappeared somewhere—and I hope he was able to get out of this damn trap—but the rest… Seems the colonel lost his mind. He started shooting the others, and then shot himself in the head. And now I’m left alone…
Hold on a second. I was here with you just a moment ago, and everything was fine. You sent me a message just a moment ago. How did all of this happen so quickly?
A moment ago?… It’s been almost a week since the moment I sent you that message. After that, I tried to make contact with somebody, but my PDA was unable to send anything.
Almost a week?! What the fuck is going on in this cursed Zone? How’s that possible? What is going on around here?
Right now, that’s the last thing I care about… Get out of here, merc. Leave me alone.
Goodbye, general.
Well, hello there, stalker. Say, do you have any food you could spare? We’re all tired of eating the radioactive mutant meat around here. Some *real* food would be nice.
No, general. I could eat a horse myself.

Yeah. Didn’t expect you to give it for free, so I have a suggestion: we were on a raid and found a couple of artifacts. Our intention was to give them to the scientists, but we’ll trade them for any food: canned goods, sausages, bread; doesn’t matter as long as it’s real food. But we need no less than eight different pieces. That should suffice. Do we have a deal?
All right, general. I’ll try to find some food for you. I’ll be back soon.
No. Can’t help you with anything.
So, Beast, are you gonna help us with our food situation?
So, found any rations?
Hey, stalker. What the hell is going on in here? Where are we?
Here you go, general. Had to pull my socks up to get a hold of this stuff.
I can imagine that. Right; you’ve held up your end of the bargain. Good work. You can make some pretty good profit off of them if you ever get out of here.
Not yet.
Wonderful. Though I’m not so sure we’ll ever get out of here… Now goodbye, general.
Hold on, stalker. We’ve got something else for you. During our last sortie, Bunchuk lost his rifle. Help him find it; you understand that things are hard for a soldier without his weapon.
Sure. Where did he drop it?
Go ask him. He’ll tell you everything.
Okay. I’ll go ask him for the details.
Hello, merc.
I’d love to know that myself. Looks like we’re trapped in some sort of anomaly… Do you remember how you got here?
What kind of anomaly?
A spatial anomaly. You’re not the only ones here: there’s a group of stalkers nearby. They’ve been inside the anomaly for a while now; over two months. So, do you remember how you ended up in here?

God damn it. Another “gift” from the Zone… Just what we needed. All I remember is that we were walking through the Agroprom, searching for some artifacts. We saw a bright light, and then, we woke up here.
Okay. Well, I’ve gotta go find a way to turn the electricity back on around here. I’ll talk to you later.
Hello, merc.
Finally starting to see how grave your situation is, are we? I’m only gonna ask you one more fucking time: where is the Compass?
God damn it! You know me, you psycho. I don’t lie; especially not about things like this.

Times change, and so do people… And now your only friends are a bunch of rotten stalkers who got stuck inside the spatial anomaly. I don’t even know what to expect from you anymore. I’ve had enough of you; Obscurant is gonna take you out to get some fresh air. Good night!
Hold on! I’m not done yet…
Rise and shine! Welcome back to the real world, dickhead.
What the hell is going on? What are you doing?
Wrong answer. I’ll give you one more chance.
I’m telling you: we don’t have the artifact.
I came here to check up on you. Jackal was beginning to worry where you’d gone off to.
Surely, you understand what you’ve gotten yourself into? How are you going to get out of here?

Why would we want to leave? We just arrived. This place is pretty nice, I’ve gotta say. We might stay a while. But if we don’t, we’ve always got this handy scanner to lead us right out. Oh, before I forget, I’ll nab yours so you don’t try anything.
Why the hell did you even come here? To save me?
You think too highly of yourself, Beast. Think: why would we save you? We’re on a mission here: to retrieve the Compass from you and your friends. *Then* we’ll get out of here.
What are you talking about?
The Compass is an artifact. Don’t act like you don’t know about it. You should’ve found it long ago. So, you hand over the artifact and you can live out your days here in peace.
But we don’t have that artifact. And if we did, we sure wouldn’t give it to you.
You need any help?

Glad you asked, merc. The gasoline in our generator is running out, and there’s nothing left in our jerry cans. No fuel means no electricity, which means no light in our base… and no light means we’re dead if any mutant or hostile stalker decides to pay us a visit at night. Try to find us some gas; in exchange, I can give you a couple of bandages and a medkit. I’d give you more, but you know how bad our conditions are.
Sure. I’ll try to find some gasoline.
Sorry, but I’m occupied right now.

I need gasoline for the generator. No fuel means no electricity, which means no light in our base… and no light means we’re dead if any mutant or hostile stalker decides to pay us a visit at night. Try to find us some gas in exchange, I can give you a couple of bandages and a medkit. I’d give you more, but you know how bad our conditions are.
All right. I’ll try to find some gasoline for the generator.
Sorry, but I’m still busy.
I don’t really need anything right now, but thank you.
If you can befriend a Dutyer, a mercenary shouldn’t be a problem…

Snake’s a good guy. We’ve found some common ground, and places like this force you to work together with whoever’s around. I’m far more concerned with getting out of here than fighting in some endless faction war.
Hey, merc. I’m listening…
Find the fuel yet, merc?
Yup. Actually managed to find a fuel canister here.
Not quite yet.
Best news I’ve heard all week. At least now we won’t have to worry about electricity for a while. Give it to me.
Here.
Focus on the zombies, merc. We’ll talk later.
Thanks, merc. That’s more than enough. You saved us big time. Like I promised, here are two bandages and a medkit as a token of appreciation.
No need to thank me. We’re all helping each other out here. See you.
Hey, merc. I’m listening…
All right. See you.
Okay. I’ll be on my way, then.
Go get some sleep or something, merc… I’m not really in the mood to talk.

Hello, merc. I’ll introduce myself… The others call me Sledgehammer. I was a member of Freedom before I got stuck here; not anymore, though. After some time here, I’ve had a different outlook on life.
Ah. Well, my name is Beast, but I assume you already know that.

I’m not going to lie: I’m not exactly enthusiastic about you being here. Your people were a constant threat to us. Had you been here a few months ago, we wouldn’t be having this conversation… but like I said, this place has changed me.
Where the hell were you, merc? I was tired of waiting for you all by myself…
Where are the others?
They left early. I stayed behind to wait for you. Where are those Duty soldiers you told us about? Aren’t they coming with us?
Well… They’re dead. Where is the exit taking us?
Darn it. Rest in peace… We don’t know where the exit’s going to drop us. Anyway, are you ready to leave?
As ready as ever. Time to leave this godforsaken anomaly.
Just a heads-up: people tend to pass out when they leave these things. Just warning you; you need to be ready for anything. Now follow my path exactly and everything should be fine. Okay?
Okay. Let’s go.
Thank you, young man. I’m getting too old for this shit… but more importantly, wildlife in the Zone has been going absolutely crazy.
Don’t mention it, old man. Who are you?

I’m Forester. I reside in the Red Forest—have you heard of it? I got your requests for help on my receiver, so I came out here to help you, using my Compass. Are you the one who called for help? Or is there anyone else here?
Wait. You came here to save us?
That’s right, sonny. That’s why I brought the Compass with me. It’ll help you get out of this trap, along with anyone else, if there are more people here.
I’m not the only person stuck here. There’s a hideout full of stalkers nearby, further to the north, and a squad of Duty members stuck underground.
Then lead me there so I can meet the rest.
Sure. Follow me.
All right. Well, enough about that. We’ve gotta bury the bodies from the bunker and pay our respects to Sledgehammer.
Yeah. Let’s get going.
Hey, Beast. Who’d you bring this time?
This is Forester. He’s going to guide us out of this anomaly.
Are you serious?! I need to talk to him right this instant. While I do that, though, there’s another signal I need you to check out. All right?
Another one?… From where?
It’s around the same place you were before. I’ll send you the coordinates now. Go there and check it out. I’ll go talk to Forester.
Right. Send me the coordinates.
Okay… There. You should have them.
Excellent work, Beast! Now we have light. How did it go?
I’ll be going, then.
Beast, let’s talk later. Go check out the signal first.
Hey, Beast, any news? Did you find any medicine that’ll help our guys? They’re not in good condition; if they don’t get any help, they’ll probably be dead within a couple of days.

I did find some medicine, but only for one time, which won’t be enough for three people. I only have two doses, and they may or may not have any effect… All because we’ve been eating mutants. We should’ve known it was a bad idea.
The important thing right now is not to give up. Right now, more than ever, we have to keep fighting. But… I could never choose who gets to live and who gets to die. Can you make that decision?
All right, Savage. I’ll hand out the medicine.
Thank you. I couldn’t do it myself. Those of us left are Knucklehead, Markus, and Cutter. Think about it and make your decision, Beast.
I’ll see you later.
When I was in the underground tunnels, I found a squad of Duty members. Five men…
Did you give them the medicine yet?
Not quite yet.
You’ve been gone for a few days. Where did you go for so long?
I’ve been looking for a cure the whole time. I even slept in the barn just in case I found more survivors…
I’m sorry: you weren’t able to save everyone. Knucklehead passed away last night. We buried him not far from the base…
And I never even told him goodbye…

Neither did I. The whole time, I was hoping he’d get better…\n \nNow, you said you were looking for medicine. Did you find any more ampules? Markus and Cutter are both feeling better already, although they still need treatment. Oh, and before I forget, we found this when searching through Knucklehead’s stuff. I think it’s for you.
Sadly, I didn’t find anything.
Jesus Christ… Do you know how long they’ve been down there?
That’s unfortunate. Let’s hope that one vaccination will be enough to get rid of the sickness. Now, you should get some rest. I need some alone time.
Yeah. See you around, Savage.
No. They only arrived in the anomaly recently.
Did you tell them about us?
I did, though I didn’t suggest cooperating with them.
Well, if they don’t want to join us, then I see no reason to ask them. We just need to make sure they don’t try anything once they run out of provisions.
I wouldn’t worry about that. We fought the mercenaries, and we’ll fight these guys if necessary.
How are you, Beast? How’s Screw? Is he all right? I’m guessing Marcus already told you what happened.
Yeah. Everything’s all right. I took out the mercenaries in the barn. Screw’s safe; he’s with me.
Sucks that Hatchet got away with his men. I think they’re out of the anomaly by now. We’ll make them pay for what happened to Sledgehammer.
The son of a bitch got my decoder, too…

So you found it after all? But it doesn’t make much of a difference now… Okay, listen. I have an idea. Already discussed it with the guys, so now I’ll take it up with you: it’s best for us to move inside this bunker. The door will keep us safe from any emissions. What do you say?
Good idea. After what happened, we’d be mad to return to the barn.
Glad we’re all on the same page. By the way, those mercenaries from earlier tried to make an escape. We had to kill them.
They made their choice. Did Markus tell you that he found the key to the storage room? We now have ammo.

Yeah. He told me already. That’s like music to my ears. We have something more important to talk about, though:
 
We have to find a way to turn on the electricity. When you turned off the lights in the barn, you must’ve shut them off here, too. I’ve already messaged Screw and asked him to turn the lights back on, but it didn’t work. There must be a transformer around here somewhere that needs restarting. Cutter and I looked around and found some blueprints; we found that there’s a transformer not far from the barn, underground. I’ll leave you to turn it back on.
 
The door to the underground is locked, but Screw assured me that he’ll pick the lock. He’ll be waiting for you there, so you should go and meet up with him.
Sure. I’ll get right on it.
What the hell happened here? Did you kill these guys?
It wasn’t me. It was that Stronglav thing. It made them shoot themselves.
Fuck, man! It can do that?! We’re lucky to be alive… We have to free the other guys. I have a plan.
And what’s your plan?
The mercenaries captured a few of our guys, and they’re holding them in the barn. First, we need to regain control there. Then, we return here and free the rest.
Yeah. I don’t think we have any other options. Also, how did you manage to get out of the hole?

Simple: I followed you after you climbed out, and I managed to break free. I was so happy I could die… But enough about that. Let’s focus: first, we need some ammo, and I know where to get it. Follow me; I’ll explain everything when we get there.
Okay. Let’s go.
All right. This place is an old army weapon stockpile. I don’t know how long these weapons have been stored here, but let’s hope that they’re all in good condition.
How are you gonna open that door?

I found the key while I was inside Stronglav’s lair. I’ve already taken some stuff for myself. You, too, should take a look inside; find yourself something useful.\n \nHere’s the key. Take whatever you need, and I’ll wait out here.
Got it. Wait for me.
Get a move on, Beast. Take whatever you need, and I’ll wait out here.
Got it. Wait for me.
So, you ready?
Yeah. I’ll let you have the key back.

Okay, so, listen up: most of the mercs are in the barn. They’re holding Screw hostage; no idea why. But we’ve gotta save him. The best option we have right now is to cut the power to the barn and take them out in the darkness. How’s that? And can I ask you something?
That’s a pretty solid plan. Though, I don’t think this is the best time to be asking questions…
It’s about what we’re doing right now. Are you sure you can take on a group of mercenaries, considering you know many of them?
I can. I didn’t make friends in the Syndicate.
That might be the case, but we have no choice. We have to do this.
Hmm. All right, then. Well, we’d better get going. I’ll go help the rest. You tackle that barn problem.
You’re right about that… Well, we’d better get going. I’ll go help the rest. You tackle that barn problem.
You got it. I’ll join you when I’ve finished up here.
When you’re ready, talk to Snake. He’ll send you the coordinates on your PDA.
Okay.
No time for chit-chat, Beast. Let’s focus on the flesh.
Hey, Beast! I’ve noticed you’re quite the detective: you tracked down the chimera with Knucklehead, you found Scavenger, and you discovered all the nasty things he was up to behind our backs.
What’s your point?
We need your help. Before Savage started leading the group, we had a leader whose callsign was Shell. He was a good man, but he went missing…
How long ago did he go missing?

About a month ago. It’s foolish to believe that he’s still alive, but I caught his PDA signal a couple of days ago, though it disappeared after a split second. It was near the abandoned shelter. I looked everywhere inside the basement for him, but there wasn’t a single trace of him there. Maybe he was using teleporters inside this place like how Scavenger was. He might be looking for a way out, if there’s even an exit… Try to find him, Beast.
Hey, this is important shit! Those zombies are closing in, and you and Mosquito are the only ones who have any ammo. Kill those braindead creatures and we’ll talk afterwards.
Hmm… And you think he could survive on his own?

Maybe. He was the toughest guy we had, with an exoskeleton and a PKM. He had plenty of supplies with him on the trip he disappeared on, too. Shell had a silver tongue and a knack for getting people to put their differences aside. He helped us found our group; an impressive feat, considering most of us were from opposing factions.
All right. I’ll keep an eye out for Shell. Maybe he’s somewhere around here.
Hello, merc! I haven’t had the chance to introduce myself: I’m Markus. We’re really glad you helped us out. At least now we have some ammunition to spare, which is amazing.
Nice to meet you. The people around here call me Beast. But you should know that already…

Yes, I do. This place we’re stuck in—is it a “spatial anomaly”? There should be to be a way out of here, and it’s up to us to find it… Anyways, if you’re not too busy right now, do you think you could help me with something?
I’m free. What do you need?
Sorry. My hands are full right now.

Nothing too difficult. I need a Wrenched artifact. It can cleanse radiation from any organism. It comes from gravitational anomalies, which there are a lot of nearby. I’m almost out of ammo, though, so I don’t want to tempt fate. I have another artifact here I can give to you as a reward; it’s radioactive, but it has some useful properties to it as well.
All right. I’ll go look for a Wrenched.
So, are you free or still busy?
Not any more. What did you need?
Yeah. I’m busy.
So, Beast, how’s your artifact hunt going?
I found it.
I haven’t found one yet.
That’s great! Now I won’t have to worry about antirads anymore… It’s been two weeks since I ran out of them. The artifact is gonna do a better job at it. Thanks, Beast.
Hey, Beast. Me and a few of the other guys were gonna go looking for some food. We need your help.
Here: your artifact.
And this is for you. I’m very grateful for what you’ve done.
I’m glad to help anytime.
Hey, Beast! Any news?
Beast, you get any leads on where Shell’s been?
Yeah. I found Shell. He was zombified, though. Had to put him out of his misery.
Not quite yet.
God… If only he had brought someone else with him. He’d probably still be alive by now. How did you even manage to take him down? Wasn’t he clad in an exoskeleton?
What exactly do you need?
It wasn’t easy, but I did it.
Was he carrying anything of note?
Just this dog tag. Here.
Yup. That’s it, all right… Thank you for your help, Beast. Here’s a reward for the hard work.
I try to help out whenever I can. See you later.
Hey, Beast! What do you need?
Right, so, Cutter told me he saw a herd of flesh nearby. Since we’re out of food, I thought we might hunt them down and cook them. Will you help the guys take them out?
All right. We’ll talk later.
Sure. I’ll help.

You’ll be going with me, Snake, and Sledgehammer. First, though—real quick—I’ve gotta go to another area, but once I’m done, I’ll meet up with you. Make sure they don’t fight each other in the meantime.
Okay. Send me the coordinates to these flesh.
I’ll help. Don’t worry.
So, Beast, have you found that SVD ammo?
Yep. Here it is.
No. Not yet.
Wow! Didn’t think you’d find it around here, but you’ve proved me wrong… Great work, Beast!
And what about the reward?
Here, just like I promised.
Great. I’ll go now.
Hey, Beast. What do you want?
Listen, Beast: thanks for clearing out those zombies. But uh, are you busy right now? I kind of need your help with something.
I’m free right now. What do you need?
So, are you free or still busy?
Not any more. What did you need?

Well, I have an SVD stored nearby. It’s a good rifle, but I have no ammo for it. Could you find some ammo for it? Just one pack is enough for me right now. In exchange, I’ll make it worth your while with an AK magazine with some cash on top. What do you say?
Yeah. I’m busy.
Sorry. My hands are full right now.
Well, look who it is!… Hello, Creature! What the fuck are you doing here?

I could say the same god damn thing to you, you moron. Do you even know just how much you’ve fucked up by coming here? If you don’t get out of my way right now, you’re a dead man. I have nothing to lose.
Well, someone’s acting tough, saying all this hard shit… But you’ll be singing a different tune in just a second. Oh, and before I forget, the Syndicate says hello.
Oh, you mother—
Thanks for saving my ass as usual, Beast. Are these guys really here just for me?
No. They’re here for some special artifact called the Compass; they think we possess it. Those motherfuckers killed Sledgehammer because of it.
Fuck this, man… That means there are more mercs out there. They must be holding our guys hostage.
Yeah. Marcus is setting up for a plan to free the rest.
Then you should go help him with that. Those guys screwed me up pretty bad, so I’d better just stay here. Okay?
Okay. Stay here. I’m going.
Oh, you’re finally here. Did Savage fill you in on what you need to do?
He did. Yeah.

Then let’s get started. I’ll open the entrance for you and head back to base on my own. Unfortunately, I’m not going down with you into the underground; there’s no telling what’s down there. You’ll do fine without me. You ready?
Yeah. Let’s go.
I’ve been tasked with finding a battery for a similar radio transmitter. Give it to me.
Yeah, merc? What is it?
Then give the battery to the soldier. I’m gonna catch my breath in the meantime.
All right. I’ll be going.
Thanks for the help, man. I think we can talk now.
You said mercenaries were after you. How come?

Well, basically, I was given an assignment by the scientists. They want me to try out a radio transmitter. Let’s see if I remember their words correctly: “Just try it out and see if you pick up anything.” I gave the thing a twist and happened to pick up a mercenary channel… and man, they were having some serious negotiations. I heard it all; my jaw was on the floor. Didn’t move a muscle. Then, the mercs finally got that someone was listening in on them, and ordered everyone to sweep the area. So that’s when this whole shitstorm started. The place was crawling with mercs within minutes, all because of my screwup. I randomly happened upon an anomaly; good thing it wasn’t a whirligig or anything… No, it was some kind of space anomaly. And now I’m here.
Do you still have the transmitter?

I have it, but it looks like it broke when I was sent here. When I was running away from the mercs, I threw it into my backpack. When I left the anomaly, I landed on it. Now the transmitter is more of a puzzle game than a working machine.
Are any of the parts salvageable?
All right. Let me have the battery for now. I’m going.
A couple of busted microchips… and a battery that I could give you, if you have any use for it.
Who the hell are you, God damn it? Tell me or I’ll shoot!
Calm down. I came here to help. Name’s Beast.
Don’t get hysterical. Calm down or I’ll put you down.
You’re dead meat, merc… All of you are dead…
Your choice…
“Here to help,” huh? I don’t need to hear that bullshit from you! What the hell do you mercs want from me, anyway? I didn’t hear anything! Go away!
“You mercs”? I’m the only mercenary in here. I’m alone.
Let’s say you’re not lying… Wait. You said “in here.” What do you mean by that?
Oh, man, you sure are unlucky. You’ve ended up in a spatial anomaly.
What? Damn it! I have to get out of here right now! Those mercenaries are gonna come back! They must’ve seen where I ended up…
Don’t panic. There’s a safe space nearby. Let’s go there and talk everything out.
Is it far? Are there other stalkers there?
Like I said: we’ll talk about it when we’re there. Come on.

You are very fortunate that the phantom didn’t take you with it, mercenary. Had you not passed its trial, it would’ve stopped you from ever waking up again. Phantoms are very deceptive, but that which fuels them is much more dangerous.
Wait. What are you saying? Who are you, even?
That is not important right now. You must stay away from any phantoms; interacting with them is tempting fate.
What’s happening here? What phantoms?

What you saw here last night was a phantom. They are the souls of dead people or animals. They appear at the site of their death, or close to their dead body. They normally aren’t dangerous, but the phantom you saw was made specifically to lure people into a trap…
The other person must have failed, then. Though I escaped.
Fortune favors you, mercenary, but fate has its eye on you now. You must be vigilant and rely on your skills and intuition more than your luck. Do not let yourself be fooled once more.
How do you know all of this, old man?
I know many things. Heed my advice, as you are already in danger. Stay alert.\n \nFarewell, mercenary. I hope we see each other again.
What?! Hey! Wait! How are you going to leave the anomaly?!
I… I can… do it… This th—iiing…
Hey, man, are you all right? What’s going on?

I can’t remember much… The Red Forest, scary. Scary place, so we took a shortcut through the Red F-Forest… Hole in one of the fences let us sneak past the Monolith patrols. First went Savage; next, good old Spotty; and finally, Hunchback, God bless him. Wait, wait, Hunch, can you get through?! Wait, can you…?
What?

I-I don’t… remember… The voice! The voice, it it it spoke to me! It got right in my head! A terrible voice spoke directly to my brain, saying stuff… Hot voice. Scorching all of my brain. Terrible… Terrible… Terrible! You cannot go there! A wild pain reminds me, sounds like that bastard at the bar… You… You can’t go there! I go where I want…! But you, you can’t. The wild pain will crush your skull and squeeze your b-brains out like lemonade…
All right, all right. I won’t. You’re safe here.

Whispers, whispers, creak of swings… It’s in my head, over and over… the voice w-w-wants me to become… one of those… monsters! *I won’t!* I… can’t… please. Take this. B-Before I… lose it… give it to Baldy. Make sure it… gets to my wife and my kids. My beautiful kids… Tell them I love them.
I will. Rest easy.
I-I’m fiiiiine… I can hold it together… Right…?
Hey, can you hear me? Is everything okay?
No! NO! I won’t let it be with me!
Jesus Christ…
My skull! It’s being ripped out of my fucking head! Ahhh!… Sp-Spotty… That’s what… They called me. Spotty. Hunchback! *Hunchback!* He died! The radiation finally got to him…
Hunchback? Who was that?
A stalker… A friend. Savage, Hunchback, and good o-ol’ Spotty went near the Scorcher. Scientists told us about cert-aiiIIINNN!!… times… we could pass through… AH! SKULL! S-Skull…
What did you do there?
First, we have to clear out the zombies nearby, or else they’ll take us with them. Do you have any ammo for a Kalashnikov?
Yeah. Had some on me before I woke up here…
Share two packs with me. I’ll give them to Mosquito; he’s a good shot. With him at your side, you’ll get out in one piece.
Okay. Here’s the ammo.
Yeah… This is bad.
We have to find Scavenger. We won’t last long here without him.

Welcome back from the world beyond, buddy… Nobody was thinking you’d be coming back to your senses; you were unconscious for four whole days.
 
Hmm… That blowout messed you up bad. Nobody would’ve survived that. But you’re alive. I don’t know whether that’s a good thing or a bad thing. The fact remains that this is very strange, though. Very strange indeed.
 
But enough about that. You seem all right, but I don’t like your merc attributes. Whose side are you on?
I’m Beast. I’m a mercenary… What is this place, and who are you?…

Hmm. A mercenary? Looks like I was right…
 
Well then, mercenary: answering your first question is going to be difficult, because I myself don’t know where exactly we are. This place here is mystical; we’ve been here for a long time, and all the while, the Zone’s been playing tricks on us.
 
As for me, though: I’m Savage. Nice to meet you. By the way, though, the guys aren’t very happy about having a mercenary around here, so I’m going to ask you to behave yourself. We’re all in a rather difficult situation, so be tactful. We all try to get along so we can make it out of here in one piece.
Merc, your help would be much appreciated right now… Zombies are heading straight for our our base. We have to take them out, or this place is going to be overrun within seconds.
What do you mean? What makes this place “mystical”?

I don’t know, merc. There’s no way out of here… You go anywhere, you always end up back at this fucking barn. We barely make ends meet around here, living another day without dying of starvation or being hunted down by any of the mutants here. Lost a lot of munitions, too, and the mutants aren’t making it any easier on us. Only God knows how they find their way here.
Damn… What have I gotten myself into? How long have you been here? And where’s my equipment?

One of the stalkers and I have been holed up in here for about seven months. The rest of us, about one to three months.
 
As for your equipment, we’re not quite sure. Around four days ago, one of our scouts was scavenging for supplies and found you conked out outside. All you had on you was a pistol, a few magazines, and your suit, which was starting to look like a floorcloth.
 
But anyways, we can’t really make you follow orders. But I suggest you become a part of our group, so you last longer with us than you would without us. Furthermore, we’d be glad to have someone with your skillset. I hope you’ve heard me loud and clear; otherwise, you’ll have a few more problems on your hands.
I understand. I have no ill intentions toward you and your men.
Is there nobody else who can help?

There’s no time to chat. You need to help Cutter. He’s the one who you brought you here, even if not all of us supported his decision. Now it’s your turn to repay the favor.\n \nAnd I noticed a few Kalashnikov mags in your uniform. If you hand me two of them, I can send someone with you. Deal?
I don’t even remember how I ended up here.

Damn this place! What do we do? Without rations or munitions, we won’t last a week! It’s been almost two months since we last saw any new stalkers. Usually, they die in anomalies, and we live off their possessions, but now… On top of that, Scavenger’s gone off somewhere.
We’ll figure something out. Don’t worry.
Who’s Scavenger?
Scavenger? If it wasn’t for him, we’d all be worm food right now! He scouted the area and gathered any valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and didn’t return.
Yeah. I think so. The worst has come to pass; his wounds don’t look fatal any more. He should be able to move soon.

Beast, if it wasn’t for Scavenger, we’d all be worm food right now. He combed the whole area and gathered any valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned… He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him—Cutter and Mosquito—but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you. Here’s what I don’t get, though: how did you manage to survive in the first place? There were blind dogs no further than ten meters from where you were found.
I don’t know how I’m still alive, but it’s important I stay that way. Anyway, I’ll go check out the area. Maybe I’ll find something.
I don’t know how I’m still alive, but it’s important I stay that way. Anyway, I’ll go check out the area. Maybe I’ll find something.
It’d mean a lot to us. No one can really replace Scavenger; he was able to gather so much stuff in a single day, and we can’t even match half of his efforts.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot you a message.
It’d mean a lot to us. No one can really replace Scavenger; he was able to gather so much stuff in a single day, and we can’t even match half of his efforts.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot you a message.

Speak to Knucklehead on that matter. He’ll help you solve the issue. Oh, also: Snake wanted to see you about something important. When you’re done with all of that, come back to me. I’ve got something else for you.
Well, this is great. I thought this was going to be our ticket to freedom. This anomaly doesn’t want to let us go… How’s that soldier? Is he going to live?
That’s great. I think this used to be some sort of military complex before the anomaly. Maybe he can give us some info about it.
All right. I’ll go talk to him.
Hey, there, Beast. Did you need something?
I need your help with a little something… We had this stalker called Scavenger. He went missing two days ago, but I don’t want to think that he’s dead.
Hey, there, Beast. Did you need something?
Hey, there, Beast. Did you need something?
Maybe so, but in his current state, he can barely even stand. Let him rest a bit.

Yeah. No need to bother him right now. I’m quite sure we have enough medicine to get him on his feet eventually. If only we had a trained medic… By the way, I see you’re looking much better than before. Some time in that bed did you good.
Yeah. I feel better; at least my headache’s over… I’ve got some provisions. Do you guys have any rations?
That’s great, Beast. Remember when I told you about Scavenger?
The looter? Yeah. I remember him. Why?
What about him?

Yeah. Scavenger combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned. He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him—Cutter and Mosquito—but they didn’t find him. Instead, what they found was you. Here’s what I don’t get, though: how did you manage to survive in the first place? There were blind dogs no further than ten meters from where you were found.
So *that’s* where the damn zombies came from. And the root of it all showed up at our doorstep… Well, we can finally stop worrying about them. Thanks for your help, Beast.
I scratch your back, Savage…
It’ll mean a lot if you find him. Scavenger was a good stalker. He’s been great help to us.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot a message.
All right. We should get out of here, or else pseudogiants will start showing up.
We’ll figure something out. There has to be an exit somewhere. Do you have anything else for me to do?
Yes, Beast. Remember I told you about Scavenger?
The looter? Yeah, why?
I remember him, but I don’t know who he is.

Yeah. Scavenger combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned. He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him—Cutter and Mosquito—but they found you instead. You offered to share your ammunition and you helped us eliminate both the zombies and the controller. For that, Beast, I thank you.

Beast, if it wasn’t for Scavenger, we’d all be worm food right now. He combed the whole area and gathered valuable supplies from corpses. Two days ago, he left camp and still hasn’t returned… He picked up on a signal not far from the base, then went to check it out and never got back. I sent a few guys to look for him—Cutter and Mosquito—but they found you instead. You offered to share your ammunition and you helped us eliminate both the zombies and the controller. For that, Beast, I thank you.
No need to thank me. I’ll go comb the area; maybe I’ll find something.
So, what did you find there, merc? Did you clear out all of the zombies?
Yes. The zombies have been neutralized. Mosquito’s fine as well.
Hmm. A spatial anomaly, you say? Does the note have any clue about an exit?
No. I have a question, though: how did zombies end up here?
The zombies are down, but… they got Mosquito.
That’s good news, merc! Did you find anything useful on those poor fellas?
What? How? Ugh. I’m sorry for the guy… But what’s better: staying around here waiting for starvation or leaving for the afterlife?…
Yeah. I found that they were a Duty squad. One of them carried a note.
Yeah. And I forgot to mention: the zombies were the remnants of a Duty squad. One of them had a note in their backpack.
What’s it say?
What’s it say?
The note describes the place we’re in: it’s some kind of anomaly. The Dutyer described this anomaly as a spatial anomaly. I’ve heard about it before…

Damn. My head… What the hell was that?! Okay, at least we know how the zombified stalkers ended up here. The root of it all showed up at our doorstep… Hey, I wonder: why didn’t you fall under its influence like everyone else?
I don’t know. One of those mutants managed to control me in the past. It very nearly managed to zombify me, but then Fish saved me.

That Fish is certainly a good man. Anyway… Good thing you managed to steer clear of that controller’s influence, or else we’d all have been on a leash. What was I thinking?… With our level of security, anyone can waltz in here without a problem. What scares me the most is that those zombies were wandering around the barn for a while, and that probably means that the controller was snooping around under our noses, too…
Right now, we need to get your guys some more ammo. Otherwise, we’ll have nothing with which to protect ourselves.

As important as that is, our key issue here is that our food supplies are dwindling. Our drinking water supplies are also getting dangerously low. Morale is dropping lower and lower every day because of it. Several of our men are saying that there’s no way out of here and that we’re all going to die of starvation. I admit, I those kinds of thoughts get to me as well, but I try to keep them at bay.
I’ll do everything I can in my power to find a way out of here.

I just hope we can still find a way out. I don’t want to die here, trapped like an animal. This was the worst present that I could get from the Zone… I just want to go back home and see my wife and daughter. Why did this Zone do this to me?…
Yeah. It’s not easy around here… Do you have anything else for me?

Listen, Beast: you look like hell. You spent a lot of time in that bed, blacked out, but I can see it didn’t help you nothing. A face-to-face meeting with a controller isn’t the best treatment, either. Go get some shut-eye; it hurts me seeing you in your current state. We’ll talk more in the morning; the guys and I are going to dispose of the controller.
Yeah… I think some sleep will help ground me.
Just a sec… Okay. The marker should be on your PDA.
Hey, Beast. Need something?
Let’s go, then.
I’m listening, Beast.
Hey. Were you looking for me?

Yeah, Beast. As you might’ve noticed, our lack of food and munitions isn’t our only problem: our supply of drinking water is dangerously low. The only water source here is the well outside the barn, but all the water in there is radioactive. Drinking it without purifying it beforehand is out of the question.\n \nBut there is one way I’ve been thinking about that would definitely make safe drinking water: from time to time, you can find an anomalous plant inside this anomaly. At one point, I was helping the scientists at Yantar, and, by using such a plant, they were able to effectively purify water.
You’re saying you want me to go flower picking? That’s not my style.

No, Beast. You won’t have to pick anything. Cutter spotted a few such plants from a tower, and he sent me their locations. I just need you to follow me and cover me. This place is crawling with mutants, and I don’t have a lot of ammo to deal with them on my own. Do you think you could help me out?
All right. I’ll cover you. When are we heading out?
We can have a chat later, merc. Right now you really need to focus on clearing out those zombies with Mosquito.
Right now. If you’re ready, of course…
I’m ready. Let’s head out.
Wait just a moment. I need to check my gear.
I’m listening, Beast.

We’re back, safe and sound, and I have the plants. Now I’ll be able to work with purifying the water for the men. Thanks for covering me, Beast. These plants should last us for some time. If you need more drinking water, come see me, and I’ll make you some.
You ready to pick some flowers, Beast?
I’m ready. Let’s head out.
Then I’ll go.
Wait a moment. Not quite ready.
No problem. I’ll come by if I need any water.
Hey, Beast. Need something?
My canteen is empty. Can I get some water?
No problem, Beast. Hand it over.
Here you go.
Right now, I’m busy purifying that water for you. Waiting for it to cool down. I’ll message you when I’m done. Okay?
All right. I’ll wait for you to message me.
Here’s your canteen. The water’s all cool and clean. You can drink it right now if you like.
Thanks, Snake. You’re a big help.
Here’s the thing: I haven’t purified the water for you yet. We’ll deal with the flesh later. Once it’s done, I’ll give you a message. ’Kay?
The water’s still contaminated. Drop by a bit later.
’Kay. I’m ready to go. I purified the water; here’s your canteen. Now let’s go hunt some flesh so we can make some dinner.
Thanks for the water. Put a marker and let’s take them out.
Just a sec… Okay. The marker should be on your PDA.
Let’s head out, then.
All right. The flesh are waiting.
All right. I’ll go later.
Here’s your canteen. The water’s all cool and clean. You can drink it right now if you like.
Thanks, Snake. You’re a big help.
Hey, there, Beast! So, you ready to shoot down a few radioactive pigs?
I’m ready. Let’s head out right now.
Great. Now let’s go hunt some flesh so we can make some dinner.
Put a marker where the flesh are at and let’s take them out.
I’m out of water. Do you think you could purify some more for me?
No problem, Beast. Hand it over.
Here’s my canteen.
Right now, I’m busy purifying that water for you. Waiting for it to cool down. I’ll message you when I’m done. Okay?
All right. I’ll wait for you to message me.
Tell me about your group.
Well, who do you want to know about?
I’ve changed my mind.

Cutter’s a strict man. He’s hard to understand, but he doesn’t cause a lot of conflict; on the contrary, he helps break up any conflict in the group, if it ever arises. He’s been here for about two months, and at first, he struggled to adapt to the way this place works. He’s gotten used to it now, and his primary role here is reconnaissance, which used to be Scavenger’s thing. All in all, he’s a decent guy, but as of late, he’s been pretty down; he keeps talking nonsense about us being stuck here forever.
Thanks for the info.

Sledge? Well, he went through thick and thin in his days. He’s not even a man; he’s a god damn force of nature. I knew him before the whole fiasco with the anomaly. Back then, he worked with Freedom at the military warehouses. He was just about everyone’s favorite person back then. When he came here, things changed, though. He found friends among enemies and generally became a kinder person. He’s been with us for about two and a half months.
Hmm. So this place has some value to it. Thanks for the info.

Young dude who, in his own words, “made the mistake of joining Duty.” If he gains some experience, he might become a very good fighter one day, but if he gets out of here, he probably won’t be joining up with his faction again. He made friends with Sledgehammer, though they both got pretty hot-headed when they first met, with the Duty–Freedom stuff and all. He’s been here for almost over a month.

Markus is the musician here. On top of that, I guess you could call him my right hand man. If there’s ever something I can’t quite deal with by myself, he’s always there to help. He was part of the original group that ended up here… Well, there was a third guy, but I’ll tell you about that another time. You could say that we brought some order to this place, if you can call it “order.” Eventually, some new stalkers came along, including yourself.
Thanks for the info.
Thanks for the info, Savage.

Mosquito used to be a marksman; hence, his accuracy is practically supernatural. If you need help from a good shooter, he’s the one to talk to. He’s kindhearted and quite talkative, and he doesn’t let the anomaly faze him. He’s been with us for about three months.
Tell me about Cutter.

Mosquito was a marksman; hence, his accuracy was practically supernatural. He was kindhearted and quite talkative, and he never let the anomaly faze him. He was with us for about three months… It’s unfortunate that he died here.
Thanks for the info.

Without Knucklehead, we’d have been much worse off. He’s a hunter and a looter. After Scavenger came here, they’ve both been helping the group by supplying us with mutant meat. Things around here just wouldn’t work without him. He’s been with us for over three months.
Thanks for the info.

Not much I need to say about Screw. He’s the heart of our group. Without him, we wouldn’t be able to maintain any of our equipment, and without equipment, we wouldn’t last very long. The guys give him all sorts of random stuff that he buys for money, and then, using that stuff, he fixes our gear. I mean, he doesn’t do it for free, but that doesn’t matter to us. He got here about a week ago or two after us, and since then, he’s been a steady helping hand.
Thanks for the info.

I won’t take up too much time talking about myself. I ended up here during the assault on Limansk. At the time, I was in a detachment together with Markus and Shell. Everyone here ended up at the same time, and not all of us have stayed alive up to this point. Shell was the leader of the detachment, so, naturally, he became the leader here too… well, until he disappeared, that is. After that, I assumed his position.
Thanks for the info.
Not at all. If you want me to share more about anyone else, just ask.
Tell me about Sledgehammer.
Tell me about Snake.
Tell me about Markus.
Tell me about Mosquito.
Tell me about Knucklehead.
Tell me about Screw.
Tell me about yourself.
Hi there, Beast. Did you need anything?
Markus should’ve returned by now, but there’s no trace of him… Do you know where he went off?
Hmm… Nope. He didn’t tell me anything. Wait just a minute; I’m gonna try pinging his PDA signal.
Go on. I’ll wait.
Beast, I think I’ve picked up Markus’ signal… or rather his last signs of activity. Head over there at once. I can tell something’s not right.
Understood, Savage. Send the coordinates and I’ll head over there.
Beast, not now. Go to Markus’ last known location and find out what happened. We have to find him.
I have info on that SOS signal incident.
I’m listening. Did you talk to the sender?
Most likely.
I’m listening. Did you talk to the sender?
Not yet.
Yeah. The stalker who sent the signal is already here; I’ve led him into the base.
I think you did the right thing, Beast. In a place like this, you need to stick together. Having another soul here won’t hurt. He does know where he is, right? Have you told him?
Yeah. When I met him, though, he told me he was being pursued by a mercenary group.
Well, that’s no good… but I doubt they’re reckless enough to jump headfirst into a spatial anomaly. Can you ask him for more information about himself? We need to know if he can be trusted.
Sure thing.
I’m listening. What happened there?
The stalker who sent the signal was killed. I wasn’t able to bring him back to the base.
Sad to hear. But the Zone is merciless. I’m sure you did everything in your power to save his life.
I found Scavenger. He’s dead.
How is he dead? Where’d you find him, Beast?
The stalkers Scavenger was looking for weren’t always dead. He killed them himself.
Strange. He never told us anything about that. Beast, we need to find that decoder; right now, it’s probably what we need the most.
Don’t worry. I’m set on finding it, too.
Great to hear that, Beast. As soon as you get more info about it, come back to me and we’ll discuss it. What else was on Scavenger’s PDA?

Hmm… Well, that’s very much like him. I’m glad he tried to help us somehow. If you find his stash, bring it to base. We’ll figure out what to do with it, and it’s not like he needs it anymore. Did his PDA have anything else on it?
So that piece of shit took all the good stuff and let us use the grimy ammo and eat mutant meat? Wonderful. If you find his stash, bring it to base. We’ll figure out what to do with it.
Are you serious? That motherfucker! If I knew about this earlier, I’d have him pulverized… Good thing he’s gone now. That’s what he deserved.
Yeah. He was a slippery type, but now he’s dead.
God damn it… And I trusted him, too… Thanks for opening my eyes. Did that rat bastard have anything else on his PDA?
Nope. That’s everything. You can have it if you want. It’ll describe everything in more detail.
Behind the fence. Seems he was using the northern teleporter to get around; that’s how I found him.
Yeah… What a slippery bastard he turned out to be. Ready yourself to look for that decoder; right now, it’s probably what we need the most.
Don’t worry. I’m set on finding it, too.
Great to hear that, Beast. As soon as you get more info about it, come back to me and we’ll discuss it. What else was on Scavenger’s PDA?

Hmm… Well, that’s very much like him. I’m glad he tried to help us somehow. If you find his stash, bring it to base. We’ll figure out what to do with it, and it’s not like he needs it anymore. Did his PDA have anything else on it?
I’ve already found his stash.
Oh? Good work, Beast. What was in it?
Ammo, medical supplies, and also a locked container. No key in the stash, either.
Uh-huh. Hand over that container. I’m gonna give it to Screw; maybe he’ll manage cracking it without a key.
Here.
I’ll call you as soon as Screw’s done opening it. What else was on the PDA?
Yeah… Sad. That guy was sharp as hell. Saved us many times…
Yeah. Turns out we didn’t know much about Scavenger at all… Anyway, Knucklehead was looking for you, and that army guy also wanted to see you. Go talk to them. I need some space to sort things out.
All right. I’ll talk to him.
Scavenger was sharp, but not that sharp. By the way, he had a PDA on him.
What do you mean, Beast? And throw that thing away. There can’t be anything useful on it…
Quite the opposite: it does have quite a few interesting entries.
Yeah? And what did you find out from Scavenger’s PDA?
There’s an entry about some kind of decoder that’s supposed to provide an exit out of the anomaly. It was stashed away somewhere, but there’s no information on where.
Scavenger kept his most valuable findings away from you and hid it all somewhere, but I don’t know where.
Hey, uh, when did Scavenger go missing?

Scavenger went missing two days ago. He picked up an SOS signal nearby and went to go check it out but never came back. When I sent Cutter and Mosquito to find him, they found you instead. Not that that’s a bad thing; I’m glad you showed up. You helped us eliminate both the zombies and the controller, and for that, Beast, I thank you.
No need to thank me. I’ll go comb the area; maybe I’ll find something.
It’ll mean a lot if you find him. Scavenger was a good stalker. He’s been a great help to us.
If I find anything, I’ll shoot you a message.
I found Scavenger’s stash.
Oh? What did you find?
Ammo, medical supplies, and also a locked container. No key in the stash, either.
Uh-huh. Hand over that container. I’m gonna give it to Screw; maybe he’ll manage cracking it without a key.
Here you go.
I’ll call you as soon as Screw’s done opening it.
Understood, Savage. I’ll come by later.
Can I ask you something?
Can you? Go ahead, seeing as it interests you.
What do you think about the other guys here?
Do you think we can really get out of here?
Who were you before you came here?
I changed my mind.
I’ve gotta go.

It’s not like I have any radical opinions on them. They’re all right people. We’re all different, but the tragedy of this situation applies to us all; we’re stuck in this mess together, like pebbles stuck in cement.

I don’t know, but even if we do find a way out, not everyone will make it. That’s for sure. I’m still amazed that we’ve been able to hold out for this long. Not only do we barely have any grub or munitions, but we have more dangerous concerns.
 
I left the barn the night before yesterday to get some fresh air, and I could smell something burning. I thought, “Maybe something’s on fire…” but then I saw a huge pillar of smoke, and I could make out a person standing in the center of it. I looked through my binoculars to see who it was, but I couldn’t see shit in the darkness. I decided to take a closer look, and, suddenly, there was a laughter. All the smoke was gone, and so was the figure inside it.
 
I don’t know what the heck that was, but it sure wasn’t anything good for us. It didn’t bode well.

I’m a stalker; a loner. I made a living working under Sidorovich, and after that, I set off to Yantar for science. They’ve got regular-paying jobs and medical supplies, and the army doesn’t sniff around there more than they have to. What sucks, though, is that those eggheads tend to send you to places so bad that even boar shit looks good in comparison. Before I ended up in this anomaly, I remember how I went up to an anomaly by myself at Yantar to gather a few specimens, and then, all I saw was a white flash.
Oh. It’s you, merc. Looking better than you did before. Thanks for clearing out those zombies earlier.
Well, I owed you for saving my hide. Say, do you remember where you found me? Maybe some of my equipment was left behind.

Of course I remember. How could I not? You won’t find anything there, though. I scouted that place far and wide to try and find your stuff on my own. I also looked at the possibility of an exit from this hellhole, but as you can see, I’m still here.
Send the coordinates anyway. I want to check the area myself.
Be my guest.\n \nThere. You should have it. Check your PDA.
Thank you. Time to go find my backpack.
So, merc, what’ve you got?

Hey, there, merc. I’m glad you’re okay. I’m basically the local technician. I’ll buy any busted shooters off of you, though my repairs and modifications aren’t free of charge; I’m getting out of this place someday, so I try to make whatever money I can. I also need to get hold of intact guns in exchange for any weapon parts. By the way, if you find any sets of tools around here, bring them to me. I’ll find a way to make use of them.
Hi, merc. Need anything repaired or improved?
I’ll keep that in mind.
Well, come see me if you need anything.
Make any progress on Scavenger’s container?

I opened it. Turns out there are quite a few goodies inside; even a set of tools, which means I can now work on additional upgrades, but let’s leave that for later. As I told you in my earlier message, you can take some of the loot for yourself, and I’ll share the rest with the others.
I’ll take it.
I don’t need that. What else is there?
That’s everything. Not much else is left in the container; only medical supplies and bullets, which I’ll be giving to Savage. He’ll distribute it amongst the others.

No problem. Here’s your shooter. And by the way, have a few rounds for it, as a bonus. They were also in the container. It’s a rare caliber; a type used by no one around here. Other than that, there are two packs of 5.45x39 mm military armor-piercing ammo. Very useful against armored targets.
That’ll come into handy. Give it here.
No. I don’t need ammo right now. What else?
All right, here. Next up is a rare artifact, called the “Black Angel.” Not bad in its qualities. It helps you withstand the pressure from psy-fields. You want it?
Yeah. I’ll take it.
I don’t need that. What else is there?
Here. Take the artifact. Not much else is left in the container; only medical supplies and bullets, which I’ll be giving to Savage. He’ll distribute it amongst the others.
Then show me what’s inside.
Inside are two packs of 5.45x39 mm military armor-piercing ammo. Very useful against armored targets.
We also have a Black Angel artifact. Not bad in its qualities. It helps you withstand the pressure from psy-fields. You want it?
Great. See you later, Screw.

Right. First thing is a 1PN58 night vision scope. Very useful item. Contains a built-in night vision device, which’ll help you spot targets in the dark. You attach it to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
I’ll take it.
Don’t need it. Show me more.
Mm-hmm. Here’s your scope. Next up, we have a decent pea-shooter: the FN FNP-45. Not exactly up to date, but its destructive capabilities won’t be disappointing.
I’ll take it.
I don’t need that. What else is there?
Got you. Next up, we have a decent pea-shooter: the FN FNP-45. Not exactly up to date, but its destructive capabilities won’t be disappointing.
Here. I found a toolkit.

You found tools for basic work? They probably won’t be of much use for any fine work, but they’ll come handy nonetheless. Thank you very much, merc. I’ll lower my prices for repairs and upgrades for you. Deal?
Deal. See you.
Find those fucking assholes!
Hey, Beast, you still busy? Can you help me out with something?
What did you need?

We need to fix this radio transmitter. A battery and two rolls of copper wire should do the trick. The copper wiring should be real easy to find, but the hard part will be finding a battery. Since we ended up here in the first place, I wouldn’t say our chances are too high…\n \nIf you find anything resembling a wire or a battery, bring it to me. I might actually be able to fix this thing, and then you can try to send a signal that’ll reach outside the anomaly. Someone will surely get the signal and help us in some way…
You have me on board. If I find anything like you described, I’ll bring it here.
I’m busy right now. We’ll talk later.
So, what’s up, merc? Find anything?
Hey, merc. See, I’m recovering in here. Decided to move into the basement so I don’t keep being an eyesore up there. It’s better for everyone this way, including myself.
Found a battery after all. Another “lucky” stalker ended up in the anomaly and shared what he had with me.
I’ve found two rolls of copper wire.
Sad to hear about the stalker, but he’s doing us a big favor. I’d even say I’m glad he ended up here. So, hand me the battery. You sure it’s in working condition?
Here you go. It’s hard to say whether it works; he took it from a broken radio transmitter, but let’s hope for the best.
Here you go. It’s hard to say whether it works; he took it from a broken radio transmitter, but let’s hope for the best.

Okay. Let’s see…\n \nYeah. That should do it. It’s just that, even if this thing works, I can’t get it to restart just yet. I just need some rolls of copper wire so I can replace what got fried. Try to find two rolls, and then we’ll try to put this pile of trash into operation.

Okay. Let’s see…
 
Yeah. That should do it. If everything works out and the transmitter successfully restarts, I can send a signal for help beyond the anomaly.
 
Come back to me in about twenty minutes. In the meantime, I’ll try to replace all the fried wiring.
Okay. I’ll come back in twenty minutes.
Hey, there, merc. Let’s talk later, you and I. Okay?
Well, that’s relatively good news. Savage said you needed me for something. Is that right?
All right. I’m going.
Hey, there, merc. What is it?
Ah. It’s you, merc. Got any questions?
Hey, merc. I’m all ears.
Nope. Haven’t found anything yet.
Excellent, merc. Hand me the wiring. Too bad that I can’t do much without a battery…
Here you go. Regarding the battery, I’ll try to figure something out, though I’m starting to think that we won’t be able to find anything.
Well, in any case, keep me updated. All right?
Yeah. I’ll be going now.

Yeah, merc. Got a very delicate task for you. I’ve found out that the radio transmitter in this basement is fixable; I’ve had my moments with these devices before.
 
What stands out is its broken battery. On top of that, some of the internal wiring is fried. I could use a couple of rolls of copper wire and a new battery. Once I have all that, I might be able to bring the thing to life.
 
It might just save the day. If we get it working, we could send a signal beyond the borders of this forsaken anomaly, and if anyone gets it, they might be able to help us get out.
Excellent, merc. Hand me the wire and come back to me in about twenty minutes. I’ll try to replace the battery and the fried wiring.
Here’s the wire. I’ll come back in twenty minutes.
All right. I’ll try to find some wiring for you.
Come back in a little while, merc. I’m still trying to get this thing working.
I managed to fix the damn transmitter after all. Now we need to find someone that we can broadcast the signal to. That’ll be my job.
Did you pick up on any outside signals while you were testing it?

Nothing interesting. I’m hearing a few sentences here and there along with some unintelligble jabbering, but they’re probably just some old broadcasts. I’ll keep scanning for more signals. Thanks, merc, for helping me repair the transmitter. Who knows? Maybe it’ll help us get out of here.
No need to thank me. We’re all together in this. I’ll see you later.
Good idea, but where am I going to find a battery, and one that still works, at that?
Well, I’m kind of busy right now. Let’s discuss that later.

Well, merc, I’m just putting some options out. It’s gonna take some persistence and luck to find a battery in these parts, but since we were unfortunate enough to end up here in the first place, I wouldn’t say our chances are too high… Two rolls of copper wire should be pretty easy to find somewhere, but without a battery, this thing won’t work…\n \nStill, if you find anything resembling a wire or a battery, bring it to me.
You have me on board. If I find anything of note, I’ll bring it to you.
What kind of help did you need?
Hey, there, merc. What is it?
Ah. It’s you, merc. Got any questions?
Hey, merc. I’m all ears.
Damn… Man… Give me a medkit, or I’m riding the pale horse…
We’re here… Thanks for the help. Who knows what would’ve happened if you didn’t come. I’m feeling a bit better now.\n \nCan you tell me where we are? What is this place?
Well, have you ever heard of a space bubble?
Well, I’ve heard things, and I know what it does in general terms. What about it?
Congratulations: you’re in a spatial anomaly right now.

Well, then… Sucks that they sent us to fly today of all days… And most importantly, how the hell did we even end up here? This place never appeared on any of our maps.\n \nWhatever. What’s done is done. I take it you haven’t found any way out of the anomaly?
Nope. So far, not a thing. Where are the other soldiers from the helicopter?
Just great… The chopper crew was most likely torn apart. Me, though… Seems like I got lucky. God damn aerial anomaly… It fried all the electronics in a split second.
Yeah. Well, get better, soldier. We’ll be needing your help soon.
All right. I’ll see if your shooter’s still around.
Hey, there, merc. What do you need?
I’m finished… Man… Man, end it. I won’t last…
Just you wait. I might be able to help you still.
You think I still have a chance? This pain is giving me hell… I can’t handle it… Ease my suffering…
You’ll live. I’ve seen worse. First, we need to get you a medkit so you can come with me to the base.
Alright… Do whatever you need to… Just… Just make this pain stop… Give me your medkit…
Here. Use this.
I don’t have any medkit right now, but I’ll find one.
default text
